CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 11, 1955, pg. 5, reads: "Fire Fans Faith - The disastrous church fire on May 16 (right photo) which started when a nine-year-old firebug lit a flame under the church's pulpit to cause almost complete destruction (center photo) has fanned the faith of most of the resident in the Dornestic Street section of the North Side's Perryville [Perrysville] sector who say they will rebuild a larger church if it means becoming 'community builders' like their forefathers who built the first mission.  Their determination is strengthened by youngsters, some shown in the second photo, who long for 'their Sunday School.'  The North Side Federation Mission was forty years old at the time of the fire.  Among the original builders who are shown in the first photo are Mrs. Hallie Taylor (second from left), Mrs. Harris and her husband, John Sr. (third and fifth from the left), Mrs. Fairy Johnson (sixth from left), and William Clay, sitting behind Mrs. Johnson.  Others shown are white-haired James E. Bannister, Sunday School superintendent; Joseph Cook Jr., assistant Sunday School superintendent; Mrs. Lucille Rose, Mrs. Hamilton, Mrs. Marie Humphries, Mrs. Ella James Hamilton, Lojay Cook, Viola Brown and Ruth Champlin. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of North Side Federated Mission Hallie Taylor, Mrs. Harris, John Harris Sr., Fairy Johnson, William Clay, James E. Bannister, Joseph Cook Jr., Lucille Rose, Mrs. Hamilton, Marie Humphries, Ella James Hamilton, Lojay Cook, Viola Brown, and Ruth Champlin, gathered in interior
